What the hell is this crap? What were the people at Universal thinking? Were they really that desperate for a film that they financed something just because it has the name Jaws in it? Ohhh please. So let's get this right, this shark has a personal vendetta against the Brody's now? Why? Did they do anything to this particular shark? Did they kill it's mommy? And if they did, why is it waiting 12 years to extract revenge on the remaining Brody's? Why didn't it come get revenge right after the first one blew up and the second one fried? I guess it had problems communicating with the dead! Oh but wait, there is more stupidity. Ellen has flashbacks of things that she was never there for. I'm sorry, was there a fourth on the Orca? Did she help Brody fire that rifle? Was she on the grassy knoll?And, yes ladies and gentleman, there is more. When Sean dies she wants to get away from it all and she decides to go the Carribbean. Hey there's an idea. Let's got to the one place where the shark actually has a chance to be. How about a trip to Northern Ontario? Or even to Wisconsin. How about Russia, Germany, Lichtenstein! Anywhere that doesn't have a salted body of water around. I know if I ever got attacked by a bear in the mountains, the first place I would go to get away from it all would be to the mountains, but a little further south! Cause ya know, bears aren't in the mountains down south! Oh and of course the shark makes it to their place of destination before they do. So as one of the other reviewers in here alluded to, I too am going to travel Air Sharky next time I go somewhere. But you know what? I have a perfect script for the next Jaws and I was hoping that maybe they would be reading this review and they could contact me. The story would be simply that Ellen Brody, Michael ( her son ) Michael Caine and all the execs that made this film should be in the next one. Hell put in Joseph Sargeant as well. After all, he is the one that tried to make a film here. So you put all of them in the film and you make Bruce a real shark and we can just watch all of them get eaten, for real. I'm serious too. That would have more of a plot and a story ( a plausible one that is ) than this piece of !@##*. You can call me at 1-976-STUPID-MOVIE.It's kind of strange, Jaws is my favourite movie of all time. I also think it is the best made film ever. Jaws 4 has got to be the worst film ever made. What a pity. What a piece of #@^*!.

I love this movie it is very great but I rather watch second and first because Brody needs to be in all of them and he died in this movie so it doesn't really seem like it's not that good but I like it so it's better than Jaws three recommend watching.

reviews.review_title: Even the shark didn't have the stomach for this!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.content: You know a film franchise is in serious trouble if the box office returns are dwindling fast and the only actress left from the first movie is the studio bosses wife!!! Even Michael Caine hasn't seen this film and he starred in it!!! To quote the actor himself "I have never seen it, but by all accounts it is terrible. However, I have seen the house that it built, and it is terrific.".With a glowing recommendation like that this is a must see movie!!! NOT!!!! The plot is crap a shark out for revenge?I think not!A shark that explodes with the same recycled shot of it sinking after it collides with the bow of a boat after standing still on the water?Please give me a break!!!! This is one of the worst if not the worst sequel that I have ever seen in my life and I've seen a few.BAD BAD BAD. Even the shark is falling apart.Stay away from this one,oh thats right everybody did!!!!

reviews.review_title: The Muppets are more scarier than that "shark"
reviews.content: In one word: STUPID!This film sucks big time! Come on, the shark has something personal against that family????? Yeah, right... That´s sooo believeable!Everything sucks. The plot, the cast (how did Michael Caine end up in this film?), the "special effects" (if there were any...). That shark looks like a toy that got away from a child´s swimming pool!Avoid this film. It´s painful to watch.No stars.

reviews.review_title: Jaws has Finally lost its bite....
reviews.content: Miserable, neurotic adults, brattish, obnoxious children and a dead shark. I know that the shark was never actually alive but in this utterly lame excuse at merchandising, it has rigor mortis, it's so damned stiff!The people trying to track down this museum piece of floating junk in the Bahamas are shouty, loud and very irritating. Then there's the emotional slush of family get together's as they reminisce and mope.Even the ever watchable Michael Caine is unbelievable - that he's in such ropey nonsense. He's hardly a bundle of joy, either. Somehow, even the tropical paradise scenery gets tainted in misery.Watching this on a commercial TV station had, for the about the first time, its upside - yes, the commercials!

This is what we want! This is what the punters have all paid to see: Michael Caine battling a shark with a personal vendetta.Disappointingly, though, Jaws: The Revenge's reputation as a superturkey of the highest calibre is a little overblown. Oh, sure, it is pretty bad, but it doesn't qualify for the premier league of celluloid waste that counts among its number Batman & Robin, Speed 2 and The Avengers.None of the Jaws sequels were really dire, of course, merely so-so and average. The first possessed possibly the most famous tagline in movie history, though was strangely unengrossing. The second suffered from the obvious demands of its 3-D format, though even that probably isn't as bad as you might remember.While obviously not containing the worth of the original mainstream classic, the sequels were popular enough to reach film No.4, which surprisingly features Michael Caine in only a relatively minor role. That said, an unusually tubby Caine does give sufficient enthusiasm to what you can tell he knows are third-rate lines. However, despite cod Jamaican accents, the general personal workings of the film are well in order, if not terribly exciting. The word of mouth that the shark is after revenge turns out to be a misnomer. The only person in the film who believes this to be the case is the traumatised Ellen Brody. Okay, there is one point where she seems to be psychic, but generally this is never as silly as it is purported to be. The frequency of the shark's attacks may seem farfetched, but never more than in any of the other films. In conclusion, the subtitle for the film seems to be based on Brody's desire for vengeance, rather than that of the "overgrown goldfish". The tagline - This time it's personal - has been similarly misunderstood.But the real sticking point comes with the shark itself. Whereas the others had used a dummy shark only sparingly, opting in the main for genuine shots of such a creature, here the action seems to be wholly taken over with an animatronic puppet. None of the movies in the series were able to do this successfully. The original and Jaws 3-D were acceptable if you squinted and applied a kind eye, whereas the second produced the odd wry smile. Here though, the dummy used looks shabby and plasticcy, several shots appearing to reveal zippers and wiring on the creature's casing. Let's be honest  even Stevie Wonder wouldn't be convinced that this was a real shark. It looks ridiculous, and every time it appears, which is often, the audience cannot help but roar their hysterical disbelief.Some hilarious goofs - including a waterlogged Caine emerging from the ocean with dry clothes, and a roaring shark - push the laughter factor even higher. Underdeveloped denouement drags this half-hearted film towards the end credits, a shambling mess with a joke as its major star, the actors only underwritten support. Yet, sadly, it's still not enough to make this a enjoyably bad film. Jaws: The Revenge suffers the ultimate indignity of merely being lacklustre. 4/10.

I am a lover of "good" bad movies...movies so bad that they are absolutely fun to watch over and over, like "Grease 2" and "Mommie Dearest.""Jaws: The Revenge" is a bad movie that it so bad it is painful. It is a shining testament to sheer cinematic awfulness. It is the all-time train wreck of a movie. What is with that shark? It is the phoniest, most laughable creature ever concocted on film. The shark appears to be plastic or paper mache and moves so slow that it appears to be on alot of Xanax. At one point, it seems to stand on its tail and roar in the truly sad finale, in which Mrs. Brody sails out to sea alone to hunt down the shark, whom she believes has been intentionally killing members of her family. I am not making this up. And what in the hell was Michael Caine thinking? Judging from this film, I have to say that he must have been suffering temporary insanity. Words can not sum up how bad this is. It's not even fun to watch...it is a painful ordeal. This makes "Jaws 3" seem like a triumphant masterpiece.

This is truly one of the worst films I've ever seen. I liked the first Jaws pretty well, thought the second one was OK but had a hunch that the second one should have been the last. Boy was I right! I never thought I'd rate a film with one of my favorite actors, Michael Caine, in it so low, but it finally happened. Roy Scheider had sense enough to sit this one out. Michael Caine should have as well. Total waste of time and celluloid.

reviews.review_title: Jaws: The Revenge by Joseph Sargent
reviews.content: The Universal Studios wanted to move on with Jaws Franchise, as Jaws 3-D did well at the box office. But the next story would not use the elements from Jaws 3-D, instead they would use elements from the first Jaws. It would be interesting to see how the next story would be developed, by using elements from the first chapter which is still iconic. But the only actress to be back for the next Jaws movie, is Lorraine Gary who appeared in the first and the second one as Ellen Brody. The rest of the cast never appeared, in any previous Jaws movies neither did Michael Caine. In 1987 came out Jaws: The Revenge by Joseph Sargent, with Lorraine Gary and Michael Caine. The movie's plot: Martin Brody's widow Ellen Brody would confront a great white shark, that is seeking vengeance by following her to the Bahamas. As the movie is the last establishment of Jaws franchise, there have been expectations to surprise the audience and the critics. Instead it completely failed by becoming, a much worse Jaws chapter than the third one. The movie has a rhythm to be boring and predictable, which unnecessarily repeat some elements from Jaws by Steven Spielberg. The attack scenes didn't work to be suspenseful, but it worked to be predictable and laughable. The score by Michael Small tries to be as workable as possible, but it does not worked to be unforgettable. The editing has been elaborated to be acceptable but the using of some footage, from the first Jaws make the narration of the story pointless by distracting the audience. The cast like Lorraine Gary and Michael Caine did well with their performances, but it would entertain not as much as necessary to make a good movie. Jaws: The Revenge is one of the worst movies of all time.

reviews.review_title: This is probably the worst one.
reviews.content: Jaws, the adaptation of Peter Benchley's novel, came out in 1975. The story was simple. A great white shark terrorizes the small Massachusetts resort town of Amity Island, so the local police chief, a marine biologist, and a fishermen go to hunt it down. Three years later a sequel came out. Jaws 2. Even though only three years had passed, the simple charm of the original was lost. It's not bad though, and it deserves your attention nonetheless. Five years after that Jaws 3-D came out. And boy was it awful, but not as much as this one, Jaws: The Revenge. The first problem I have with it doesn't even have to do with the movie itself. It's the title. Jaws: The Revenge. Why not just call it Jaws 4? I know that Jaws 3-D was a gimmicky name (to match the gimmicky special effects) but at least it had the number 3 in the title. I guess it's because Jaws 4 (or Jaws: The Revenge) ignores any plot elements that were introduced in the third film, but continuity honestly wouldn't be that bad. Anyhow, I'm kind of getting into the weeds here. Ellen Brody (Lorraine Gary) has just lost her son Sean Brody (Mitchell Anderson) to yet another shark attack. When her other son Michael Brody (Lance Guest) comes to visit her she tells him that this time, it was personal. The shark came and ate Brody because of some kind of blood oath against the Brody family. That means that apparently this shark is in the same family as the other two (or three depending on whether or not you count Jaws 3-D). Or maybe it's just the same shark that somehow keeps coming back to life. It honestly wouldn't be any less ridiculous than anything else this movie. After hearing the ridiculous theory of shark vengeance Michael decides to help his mother get over her fear of the water by taking her to the Bahamas, hoping that even more water will somehow help. Well surprise, the shark follows them from the United States to the Bahamas, solely to fulfill it's revenge mission. I'm not even going to attempt to explain the plot from there. You've got subplots like Michael's research on underwater snails turned research on the shark, Ellen's growing delusions as well as her relationship with Michael Caine, and some other stuff. At the end of the film the shark blows up once again, this time because the bow of the boat merely touches it. It shouldn't be hard to realize what's wrong with this movie. Aside from the clear delusion that sharks can choose a certain person like a serial killer, the shark half the time doesn't even go after the Brody family. There's a part where the shark goes after the granddaughter and then deliberately misses her and goes after someone else. The revenge aspect isn't even focused. The bottom line is this was finally the last Jaws movie, and thank goodness too, because they just kept getting worse and worse.

This movie sucks. Totally uninspiring, everything is bad. A disgrace for the franchise.The shark is so fake. There is no tension, no real drama. Even the music is bad.Too bad Michal Caine is in it. A waste of his talent. Flirting with Lorraine Gary it was as bad as it sounds. Go see Sharknado instead!.P.S. A TERRIBLE FACT. Judith Barsi (the little girl) was hot to death along with her mother at a tender age of 10 by her father, who then shot himself to death.

reviews.review_title: So end the "Jaws" series, which shouldn't have been a series in the first place
reviews.content: "Jaws The Revenge" concludes the series about a shark attacking Amity Island. This time, the shark apparently knows about the Brodys, so he's out on revenge (hence the title). Ellen Brody knows of this and tries to get her oldest son to quit his job as a marine biologist.Overall, this movie was just god-awful. Now, "Jaws" shouldn't have been made into a film series, but money has persuasive ways. The writing was absolutely awful, I really felt that it should have been called "Jaws: The Mediocrity," or "Jaws: The Voice of Reason: Don't make anymore 'Jaws' movies," or maybe even "Jaws: The End." Don't see this. It's the right thing to do.

reviews.review_title: The end of the line for Mr. Whitey
reviews.content: Mercifully, the increasingly ludicrous JAWS series came to an end with this mediocre third sequel to the 1975 suspense masterpiece.  Lorraine Gary returns as Ellen Brody, convinced now, after her youngest son, the Amity town sheriff, is killed in Amity Harbor while investigating a shipwreck, that the shark is now after her entire family as "revenege"(??).  She tries to unwind in the Bahamas with her oldest son Mike (Lance Guest) and a local pilot (Michael Caine).  But the shark won't let her, and it comes down to a climax that, while spectacular, is also totally ludicrous, and not helped by the device of Gary having flashbacks to events in the original film she was never even a witness to.The only thing that saves JAWS 4 from total disaster is the relatively good direction of Joseph Sargent (COLOSSUS: THE FORBIN PROJECT) and Michael Small's score, which integrates John Williams' original theme.  Otherwise, this revenge is a dish either best eaten cold or not eaten at all.

Upon viewing this film I was taken aback at the shear beauty of this craft we call film.  The superb writing, acting, direction can not even be described with words because there are no words other than perfection that can be used.  Ex.  The mother (Ellen Brody) remembers a flashback that she was not there for but it doesn't even matter because the flashback is in black and white symbolizing a flashback.  Also the shots of the shark growling because of anger against the people who have done it wrong. Revenge Is A Dish Best Served Cold.....But Jaws The Revenge Is Hot!! Don't miss it!!

reviews.review_title: An insult to the legacy of JAWS!!!
reviews.content: A shark stalking the Brody family because it wants revenge for it's murdered predecessor's? Great script idea! If that wasn't lame enough try some of the worst special effects ever seen. Jaws looks nothing more then an inflatable shark balloon! Like one of those kids pool toys! What the hell was the budget 15 dollars? And how about the horrible acting. Yeesh! Another disappointment was the fact that hardly anyone gets killed or eaten, save for SEAN BRODY and some woman on a banana boat. (And JAKE only in the original U.S ending). The ending was kinda of decent where Jaws gets bloodily impaled but then the ending gets re-cut (for TV,video and Europe) so Jaws suddenly explodes when punctured. UGH! What a mess. I pray HOLLYWOOD makes another Jaws movie, just to re-deem this once great movie monster!

reviews.review_title: It is a definite must see! It made me laugh SO HARD! Wait...WHAT!?It's not a comedy?
reviews.content: This is an embarrassing movie. It doesn't deserve life. It made Jaws 3 look like The Godfather or Shawshank Redemption. IT MADE ME WANT TO SEE BATMAN & ROBIN!The fact that Bruce(I Don't THINK STEPHEN SPIELBERG Meant FOR HIM TO BE NAMED!)the shark can ROAR like Godzilla and King Kong is a stupid idea. And that is almost as stupid as the idea of a shark getting revenge...AND IT Wasn't EVEN REVENGE! He already ate the son, following them to that island isn't revenge, it's really the mom's revenge anyway for stabbing him. And if it WAS suppose to mean the moms revenge, then how did she know it was that same shark? There are millions of sharks around those Caribbean islands.Now I please ask the people that wish to see this, see an actual horror. Like The Shining, The Excorsist, A Nightmare on Elm Street, Cabin Fever, and Scream. But I say if you are looking for a comedy you should watch this movie, at first I thought this movie was a SPOOF of Jaws(Also for some good laughs see Animal House, Caddyshack, Monty Python and the Hunt for the Holy Grail, Airplane, and Blazing Saddles).

reviews.review_title: The Movie should of been a comedy
reviews.content: I would just like to start off by saying that I am in absolute hysterics reading peoples comments and they are mostly spot on. Jaws the Revenge was so horrible and laughable the movie should of been made a comedy. The movie was that bad and lame it wasn't far from the shark having the ability to speak and maybe doing a song and dance at the same time. Whoever made this movie and I don't want to know has problems if they themselves took this movie serious. I wonder what on earth this person was thinking?!?!? Maybe the director was thinking along the lines of a spoof, but still wanted the movie to be scary? I agree with most people, Jaws a masterpiece, Jaws 2 very good, Jaws 3-D ordinary and the Revenge a down right disgrace.The people behind Jaws the revenge are a joke for disrespecting the first two Movies Jaws and Jaws 2.

Who's stupid idea was this then?  And what was Michael Caine thinking -- it would be any good?Get a member of the Brodie family, chuck a shark at them and fill in the rest yourself.  Not in the same league as The Postman for terrible films, but not far off.You didn't even have the fun of seeing how stupid your mate looked in those 3D glasses from Jaws:3D.  Terrible, no more of these please.

reviews.review_title: Not the best but by no means the worst!!!
reviews.content: Well where do I start off, JAWS one of the best "when animals attack" horror flicks. The story of a mans quest to kill a great white which has been terrorising his town. JAWS 2, the same mans quest to kill another great white. JAWS 3, the story of a couple of loons trying to get rid of a shark from an amusement attraction and finally JAWS 4, the story of a shark thats trying to kill the first mans family.Yes I know, the fourth instalment sounds really long winded but hell I thought Id give it a chance. After being a keen fan of all the Jaws films (well I like watching the first 2) I have to admit I did not find this film that terribly bad. If you want to see bad watch the third installment with its visually sickening special effects and gruesome acting. Jaws 4 has seemed to be cast as the worst sequal because people think that the story line is so unbelievable. Come on which one of the films is completely believable. It showed potential at the beginning however did go down hill then after.On overall this film is not a good one but it is watchable and in fact if take lightly fairly enjoyable. Lets all forget about the rest of the films for a second and think if this was the first it would have been rated alot higher but since its predicessors were so incredibly good (with Jaws 3 the exception of course) which movie could live up to them. So look lets all give it a break and hope that one day a tremendous JAWS 5 comes out.

Sure it's cheesy n dumb, but it plays up the ptsd of being terrorized by this shark and having lost family members because of it. The action shark scenes I thought were entertaining. I would say the 2nd movie of the franchise was the worst and this and the 3rd (in 3d) are actually worth watching.

reviews.review_title: You wish if this movie never existed
reviews.content: In my opinion, I've seen two good "Jaws" movies, then the third one came which I thought it was lame and now I've seen the fourth one that takes the cake for being the absolute worst of the franchise. Where do I begin? Well, I give you one thing about what is the plot of this ridiculous movie: another great white shark comes in, but instead of attacking more people it wants revenge on the Brody family. Wow! That has got to be one of the most stupidest and ridiculous plot that I've ever heard in my entire life. From the show "Siskel & Ebert," Roger Ebert asks Gene Siskel what shark is this? A brother? Cousin? Maybe a distant relative? I don't know, but this revenge plot really makes no sense at all; its hardly a revenge movie because the movie keeps focusing more on some parts that we don't care, and while the shark only pops in whatever it feels like it. If its not focusing well with the revenge plot, then just call it "Jaws 4." Also, the movie has many errors like Michael Caine's character coming out of the water while his clothes is almost completely dried off (thanks to Siskel & Ebert); then you have the shark that knows where to find our human characters from traveling the United States to the Bahamas, and last but not least, the shark roars like a lion. Sharks can't roar! Here is another thing, how is the shark able to reach out to eat people by what using its tippy toes or thinking that the shark is Mr. Fantastic? I blame how the movie was written by a bad screenplay. Even the movie is badly directed by Joseph Sargent who also produced this. Do both the writer and director know that sharks can't roar, and making some dumb excuses that the shark is being powered by the magic of voodoo? Heck, they made Martin Brody's wife Ellen who she thinks is Spider-Man that her sharky senses are tingling, and having these flashbacks that she wasn't there. Except where she witnesses her granddaughter who almost got killed by shark, and watching her late husband and son having their moment at a dinner table from the first one. The dialogue in this movie is really terrible like Ellen's granddaughter asking about Uncle Sean coming back. Uh...he just got killed by a shark, and can't come back. Such a dumb question that she brought up. I really hated that the filmmakers made Ellen saying that her husband died because not only a heart attack, but his fear of sharks. Lorraine Gary should've know about this, as she may have seen the first two movies where Martin was trying to be brave and strong to kill two sharks; she could've say no to say that line because its really insulting to Roy Scheider's character, but no the filmmakers want her to say it and just made everyone mad on how much we love Roy Scheider from the first two movies. I find it just as bad as making Megan Fox's character looked bad in the third "Transformers" movie, where she was replaced by a model that can't act. I don't think the acting in this movie is good, and I don't buy Lorraine Gary as the lead. She is no Ellen Ripley. By the way, I like to point out that when she sees her granddaughter almost get killed by a shark, she steals a boat or ship as we know that she can't take it anymore but here is one question: if she is going to steal a boat to find the shark, then why can't she bring any weapons to kill it? She is not well prepared onto anything. Heck, after Sean dies at the opening scene, some cop leaves Ellen her son's gun and never bothers to take it with her to kill the shark. Well Ellen, you are some hero. You know that? Some hero. I do feel sad for Michael Caine for doing this movie, and I think I'm sure that he regretted for not attending the Academy Awards for getting his Oscar on his work for "Hannah and Her Sisters." I never saw that movie, but I wish if he hadn't done this movie. The shark itself looks good on the first three movies (while the third movie made the shark cheap looking in 3D), but here its so darn fake looking. The effects in this movie are just as bad as the effects from "Superman IV: The Quest for Peace." This movie won the Razzie for Worst Visual Effect over the fourth "Superman" movie. The movie has two ending that were filmed: one the shark gets stabbed, and two it explodes for no reason while Michael Brody's friend survives. I don't care which ending I like best, because they both have bad effects and they're both lame. I do kind of like Caine's reaction of the shark before his plane got taken down. Oh, I also don't care for the music either. You wish if this movie never existed, but hey this is the last one and I am glad that its all over. I think the "Sharknado" movies are more entertaining than the last two "Jaws" sequels. I give "Jaws: The Revenge" a flat out zero. But I have to give it a one, because giving it a zero won't make its 2.8 rating go down. I wish I could, but got to be respectful to IMDb's rating system; and seriously, this movie sucks!

reviews.review_title: This one should be shown in cinema schools, definitely
reviews.content: --- Spoilers, but who cares anyway ? ---As cinema students learn about all the aspects of movie making by analyzing important motion pictures in the history of the 7th Art, teachers should put "Jaws : The Revenge" in some educational program for it definitely sums up the whole aspects of what SHOULDN'T be done in a film project.Everything in this continuous stream of garbage is marked by the seal of panic, mischief, mayhem, ugliness.Examples ? Name them ! From Lorraine Gary's tiresome lack of expression and facial unattractiveness to the mechanic underwater crane holding the shark robot that can be clearly seen in many shots, from the atrocity of a script talking nonsense about some shark revenge to the abomination of the last scene (shark roars (!) before being impaled (!!) on the boat's broken mast then ...explodes (!!!) - please don't ask me), from Michael Caine doing usual prostitute job to pay his taxes to all the major plot holes that Stephen W. Hawking would like to write a theory about... all of this defines some kind of universe where professional laziness seems to be the golden rule to follow, and was followed by everyone involved, from the smallest prop guy or extra to the most important Universal executives who gave a "go" to this miserable piece of crap.A great lesson about movie making for any student who wants to get some knowledge on NOT what to do in a film.
The best way to describe Jaws: The Revenge is absolutely unwatchable, poorly written, illogical, completely tensionless, ridiculous dream sequences and a menace to society.

Jaws: The Revenge can be summed up in one word: an insult. That's right, this movie is an insult to the original ground breaking 1975 classic. It is also insulting to the audiences who should feel cheated and insulted at this atrocity of a movie. It should be an insult to the many actors involved in this movie, including but not limited to Michael Caine and Mario Van Peebles. Steven Spielberg, director of the first movie should feel insulted considering the memory of the first movie has been stomped on but then again he has nothing to do with this movie. Peter Benchley, the author of the novel Jaws which the first movie was based on should also be insulted that this marked the death of the Jaws franchise. I should also add that this should be an insult to Universal Studios who was responsible for this, but then again somebody must have thought that this was going to be a good idea and like a cash cow, milk it for all its worth.Jaws: The Revenge focuses on the now widowed Ellen Brody (Lorraine Gary) and her family is being targeted by a great white shark following the horrific death of her deputy sheriff son Sean (Mitchell Anderson) who was killed while on duty. She becomes further paranoid when she believes a great white has followed her and her family to the Bahamas to target the remaining family members in revenge for the deaths of the sharks in the first two Jaws movies.The tagline sums up the entire movie: "This time it's personal". Are you serious?! Are audiences REALLY meant to believe a great white shark is going to seek revenge on family members with its own vendetta. I'm very puzzled here. Are audiences meant to get excited about a shark targeting members of the Brody clan after Martin Brody (Roy Schneider) killed the infamous great white shark from Jaws (1975) and Jaws 2 (1978)? This is completely wrong and surely someone must have piped up during the development of the forth movie and said "This is going to be a bad idea" unless they were told to shut up or they decided that this was going to be a good idea. Already this movie was going to have disaster written all over it.Jaws is a classic, the second movie was worth watching, and the third was an inferior movie which should have ended the Jaws series at number 3 (actually it was Jaws 3-D to capitalise of 3-D movies).Jaws: The Revenge should be left to sink to the bottom of the ocean.1/10.

reviews.review_title: Easily the worst in the series
reviews.content: If you though "Jaws 3" was bad, you've seen nothing yet. "Jaws: The Revenge" is worse. And I mean a lot worse. This is one of the most poorly made and badly acted movies that I have ever seen. Joseph Sargent, the director of this trash, is a good director. He has directed lots of movies mostly on TV. He's won a couple of Emmy Awards to prove it. But what on earth was he thinking of when he made this. Certainly he got no help with the script. The screenplay is by Michael de Guzman. How can somebody write a script that is so incredibly stupid? The plot of "Jaws: The Revenge" is such an incomprehensible mess that it has to be seen to be disbelieved. And what about that acting? It was a travesty to see Michael Caine in this movie and watch him waste his considerable talents. And what was even more shocking is that when he won his first Oscar for Woody Allen's "Hannah and her Sisters" in 1987, he didn't show up on Oscar night to collect his award; he was making "Jaws: The Revenge"! Lorraine Gary (reprising her role from the first two "Jaws" movies as Ellen Brody), Lance Guest, Karen Young, Mario Van Peebles, and (the late) Judith Barsi all give bad performances thanks largely in part to the hilariously awful script. An easily seen continuity error late in the film proves that "Jaws: The Revenge" is as ineptly made as everybody has said. Oh, I forgot to mention the performance of Bruce the Shark. Whoever made that shark didn't even try to make it look real and convincing. The shark ended up looking fake and unrealistic. And as a result, of all these bad qualities help to sink "Jaws: The Revenge". And boy does it sink fast. Only the beautiful Bahamas locations keep me from giving this catastrophe no stars.1/2* (out of four)

reviews.review_title: This Film Should Have Been Shark Bait!!!
reviews.content: Why in the name of everything holy did they make this piece of CRAP?!?! Lorraine Gary and Michael Caine (He missed picking up his Oscar for THIS???)SHOULD have know better that to participate in this garbage in which widow Brody(Thank God Roy Scheider skipped this one)ends up in the Bahamas after her son Sean is killed by a shark. reviews.review_title: If I could go back in time I would erase this rotten bucket of chum of a movie from history
reviews.content:
Jaws The RevengeI've decided to review this movie because I recently watched The Shallows and I believe it could've been a worthy sequel to the original Jaws. 
Don't get me wrong The Shallows isn't nearly as good as the original Jaws and it did have a few flaws but compared to Jaws The Revenge it is a masterpiece. 
So where do I start with this rotting pile of chum? 
Never in the history of filmmaking as a script writer concocted such a ridiculous premise. Basically a shark has taken revenge on the Brody family. The film starts out with the youngest son of Chief Brody being munched by a new giant killer shark. Widowed Ellen Brody (widowed because no amount of cash could get Roy Scheider to star in this tosh!) believes the shark is out for revenge and will hunt them down each individually. WTF!!!
No amount of drugs or alcohol can prepare you for such a ridiculous idea for a film. To such ridiculousness that the shark follows them from Amity island to the Bahamas. Really?!!! Unlike the original Jaws and The Shallows this movie has absolutely no suspense. We are shown the shark way too early and oh my God does it look crap! It's so bad it makes the rubber shark from the original film look like they've stolen a real one from the Discovery Channel . The model shark in this terrible film looks like it was made out of papier-mâché!
The studio must've spent the entire budget for this film on Michael Caines new house. Because surely that is the only reason why such a talented actor would sign on to star in this rubbish! 
Gone are Michaels famous lines like "You're only supposed to blow the bloody doors off" To be replaced by "Oy get off my bloody leg!" Actually I don't think that line was in the movie but if it was it would've made the movie two hundred percent better. 
The climax of the film involves electrocuting the shark with a completely made up device. Every time the shark is shocked it growls like a tiger! Since when do sharks growl or make any noise for that matter? It's bad enough that they come up with the stupidest idea ever put on film but they have to make the shark growl too?
Somebody kill me now is what I was thinking as I watched the climax of this, the worlds crappiest, most stupid, ridiculous movie! 
This film is downright disrespectful to Spielberg's masterpiece.I'm sorry but the question needs to be asked people. Is the shark out for revenge for being killed in the previous three movies or is he just upset because the Brody family killed three of his buddies? Why not ask such a ridiculous question since the movie is totally ridiculous anyway? 
We could forgive this film since now there's stupid films like Sharknado but at least they are not taking themselves seriously. They're meant to ridiculous. 
The problem is whenever Jaws The Revenge is on TV I have to watch it because it's like a train wreck! I just can't take my eyes off it. More fool me.I hate Jaws the Revenge with a passion!
Hate is a strong word but I do.
I hate it because it soils the brilliance of the original. I hate it because every time it's on TV I'm drawn to it like a rabbit to a trucks headlights. 
If I could go back in time I would erase this movie from history.
It's the Jaws movie that killed the Jaws franchise and for that I can't forgive.
It's even worse than Jaws 3D and that's saying something.

This is one of the worst movies I have ever seen in my life.There is no comparsion to the original film.All these cheap sequels did was ruin the power of the orginal.Mrs Brody should have swam alone in 1975 at night!The trouble is everything.Jaws looks terrible.The screams.The horrible ending with the stick in the neck!!!!!!!!This film is what is wrong with lala land.They can never leave anything alone.This is same story with what was done to halloween.WHY CAN'T THEY LEAVE ANYTHING ALONE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
-10.00 is my score.

reviews.review_title: It's Been 12 Long Years Since The First Encounter, And This Shark Still Holds A Grudge.
reviews.content: Jaws: The Revenge is not that bad of a movie, much better than 3 which was horrible; and laughable. I gave it a 6 because I am a huge fan of the first two, but really deserves a 5-1/2 because of the ridiculous ending.It is around Christmas in Amity, Ellen Brody( Lorraine Gary) is now a widow. Shawn Brody( Matthew Mitchell) is now a Deputy on the police department. He's a very young deputy at age 20, and Ellen worries about him all the time. Sean's brother, Mike ( Lance Guest) is now a Marine Biologist in the Bahama's. The two love their work, but Sean still lives with mom until he gets married. One night Sean is on duty, when he gets ready to leave a call comes in. A piece of driftwood is stuck on a channel marker, which is a hazard. Sean goes out and checks it out, he starts to remove the wood off and his attacked by a shark. He is killed and his mother in complete shock.When she finds out a shark is responsible for the attack, she believes a shark is stalking the whole family. After Sean's funeral Mike and his wife tell mom to come to the Bahama's. She does on Mike's private plane, flying it is Hoagie( Michael Caine). Hoagie and Ellen develop a relationship why she is there, but she is still traumatized with bad dreams. She begs Mike to quit his job, but he shrugs it off.One day Mike and Jake( Mario Van Pebbles) are working together and are almost attacked by a great white shark. It attacked the boat, but what a scare for them. It is odd because great whites are not found down there. Mike tells Jake not to say a word about what happened to his mom. Ellen still continue to experience nightmares, then Mike begin's to have them.When Mike and Jake come up with a plan to track the shark, so they know the location at all times. The tracker monitor's the sharks heartbeat at all times. When Ellen takes another boat out to hunt the shark down. Hoagie finds out contacts Mike and Jake and now they look for her. When they find her they all get on the boat. They realize they lost the signal of the shark so the have to be cautious. Hoagie and Jake look for her by air, Mike by boat. When Hoagie lands the plane on the water, Hoagie gets out, but Jake is still in the plane. All of a sudden the shark appears and grabs Jake. Mike eventually kills the shark and 10 minutes later Jake comes out of the water. This ending is one of the worst, killing a higher ranking on the film. A plus in this movie that helped was the cameos of Mrs. Kitner( Lee Fierro) and Mrs. Taft( Fritzi Jane Courtney), both from the original Jaws. This movie is great to watch around Christmas or a day that blows; but nothing will ever beat Jaws or Jaws 2

Moronic (and hopefully final) sequel opens with Ellen Brody's youngest son getting his arm ripped off by a--you guessed it--Great White shark, which then travels to the Bahamas to dine on her other son, now a marine biologist.  She is convinced that the very same shark has terrorized her family, despite the fact that the previous culprits had been blown up or electrocuted, and is determined to stop it this time.  Astoundingly bad at times; how Michael Caine was conned into this we may never know.

reviews.review_title: I'm sure a lot of audience members would like their revenge for this movie...
reviews.content: We all knew it would come to this sooner or later. Jaws... is a masterpiece in horror movie making and is considered by many as one of Steven Spielberg's best (rightfully so). Jaws 2 is decent, flawed but saved by Roy Scheider's great performance. Jaws 3 is... a funny movie.But then there is Jaws: The Revenge... Why was this movie made? Did they really expect us to go "Oh, that makes sense" at this egregious premise where a shark goes after Martin Brody's wife as revenge? This doesn't make any sense whatsoever considering the shark Martin hunted DIED. All right? He killed him. But considering we now have a shark which is so p'issed off it swims aaaaaaaaaall the way to Bahamas, that has to mean it's another shark who was informed one of his friends died and so now decides to go after Ellen. You might believe this is a joke, but it's not! This is what actually happened!The acting is a joke. Lorraine Gary is decent for what she has to work with, but the rest? Not very good. I don't remember much about Michael Caine's performance (he probably tried, but the stupid script didn't give anyone good material to work with), but Mario Van Peebles... He was absolutely ABYSMAL! What was up with the hokey slang he had to speak all the time? He sounded like an idiot! Whenever Jake (that's his character's name) was on screen, I was either laughing or shamefully shaking my head.The shark itself looks... weird. It's very different-looking from the other sharks, although mostly in a negative way. It has a really silly design and makes you chuckle rather than horrified. Christ, the shark in Jaws 3 was at least believable enough to make the movie work. What I'm seeing here though, is a plastic toy. Was the budget a nickel or something?The worst sin though is how boring this movie is. There are several scenes where you hear these knuckledhead characters "talking" with each other and you are just waiting for it to END already. If you are gonna develop characters... GIVE US CHARACTERS WORTH DEVELOPING!It's funny because it's so bad... but it's groan-inducing for the same reason. I wouldn't say I don't recommend this movie, but I only recommend it if you want to see something which at least almost is unintentionally funny. If you are looking for what resembles even just an OKAY installment in the Jaws franchise... you've got better shi't to do.

Jaws The Revenge Is just boring The very beginning Right when Shawn gets eaten the camera is moving so much I have no clue what is happening The Shark looks horrible when it turns it looks like someone is turning it in this movie and makes noises just why and it screams like a lion at the end in this movie Elien Brody sees The shark when someone else is getting eaten She does not even witness the shark attacks she randomly sees it It's just very boring I do like Jake as a character that is really it and the end was not good either I watched the alternate ending which is better to me I give Jaws The Revenge I give an F.

My question is simply....WHY....WHY did this film even make it to the theaters. This terrible excuse for cinema makes Halloween 5 look like The Godfather, and believe me, Halloween 5 is BAD. How can anyone even consider making a Jaws movie where the shark actually targets the Brody family. I know movies can be a little far fetched, and I tend to be an open minded person, but there's a limit as to how far fetched a movie can be for me. I could understand Jaws 3 (Jaws 3D) being okay because it was the time of 3D movies. If it's a 3D movie, odds are it's not out to make history, and who cares if the plot sucks, the effects are enough to keep the crowd busy. But this movie didn't even have 3D. It had a crappy-looking shark that looks like a souped up pool toy and a plot that had more static than a kid walking across a carpet in socks in the winter time. I often say this movie is good for the elderly because some of the acting could stimulate even the most constipated old person. Michael Caine, as much as I respect him as an actor, was at his worst (probably because the movie sucked so he couldn't bring his best performance out in the first place). Mario Van Peebles...please...I've heard Asian people who've done better Jamaican accents than that. Lance Guest...not much to say...not his best performance (even though I've only seen him in Halloween II and this film). Lorraine Gary and Judith Barsi (God rest her soul) pulled it off. Judith was just as cute as could be, and I felt for her after the banana boat attack. Lorraine Gary seemed to be the only adult who actually gave a good performance. Despite this movie's haphazard and impromptu feeling, she knew what she had to do and she did it. I could go on and on and on...the only movie I've seen that sucked worse than this one was Date Movie.

reviews.review_title: Just when you thought it was safe to go back to the movies...

Let's forget the ropey plot and the hilarious special effects.  Beyond all that, we have the pain of actually watching the tortured cast struggle through the inane script.  Horrible horrible horrible, made even worse for the fact that it's made as a sequel to one of Hollywood's best.  I wish I could give it none out of ten. Thankfully, though, there was no Jaws five.  perhaps the shark could have eaten whatever studio heads greenlighted this load of manure.

reviews.review_title: Let's try this again, shall we?
reviews.content: I could've sworn I'd written a review earlier about this movie. It's not there now but I'll gladly submit another one. People, this is quite possibly the worst sequel, if not the worst film of all time. Why this movie was made is beyond me. What'd they think, that by having loving flashbacks of Roy Scheider, they'd gain some sympathy? This movie is an utter and complete failure and speaking as a big Jaws fan, a complete insult. I'd rather run across a busy freeway wearing a blindfold and cement shoes than watch this mush again. Nobody walks away unscathed from this one. Michael Caine must've slapped himself repeatedly while watching this. Or maybe they paid him well enough so that he didn't feel the need to. Lorraine Gary received a special Razzberry award for her performance if I'm not mistaken and rightfully so. She stunk in this movie, and to high heaven. The shark put in a better performance than her or anybody else in this hunk of junk. Mario Van Peebles succeeded in making me angrier than I ever had been. I'm actually sorry that his fate in the movie wasn't replicated in real life. Okay, I don't really mean that but somebody who's responsible for this splooge has to die by shark attack. Whoever greenlighted the whole "great white shark attacks the Bahamas" pitch, maybe. The pain! I'm gonna end my review here because I wanna save some of my insulting comments for other films that deserve them and also because it's causing me great, great pain to continue thinking about this schlockery. Rating: ZERO out of *****. (I wish I could rate this lower, I'm so insulted.)

reviews.review_title: SERIOUSLY... Get Out Of The Water!!!
reviews.content: How far the mighty have fallen! What started off as a chilling horror/ adventure film by Steven Spielberg has been turned into a downward-spiraling series put out by Universal Studios. Happily, I think it's safe to say that Bruce the shark can finally rest on his water-logged laurels after this. Here's the half-baked story: Off the coast of Amity Island (yet again), people are being devoured by (yet again) another great white shark. Sean Brody falls victim to the critter. So now Mrs. Brody, in mourning over losing both a son and her husband, travels down to the Caribbean to be with her other son, Michael. In the most nonsensical plot devise, it turns out the shark is purposely hunting down the Brody clan. So now, it's off to the Caribbean. Where they run into a playboy with a plane (played by the always-wonderful Michael Caine) and suffer incredible loss at the teeth of this vengeful shark. *Head shake!* If you simply MUST complete the JAWS series, then do so. But don't say I didn't warn you. Seriously... get out of the water!!!

reviews.review_title: The Shark was one step away from climbing out of the water and asking if they've seen any Brody's going around...
reviews.content: Seriously this is one of the goofiest films of all time. It was so bad it was kinda funny. I don't think you will ever see a more dramatic collapse in a franchise from the first to the fourth as you do in the Jaws movies. Jaws the original is possibly the greatest movie of all time, Jaws-the revenge is possibly the worst movie of all time, and has often been rated as such!What is semi bizarre is the fact that at the beginning, it actually starts off surprisingly- the opening attack and killing of Shaun Brody (the Brody's youngest boy) whom is now grown up as a cop in Amity replacing his now deceased dad whom apparently died of a shark motivated heart-attack?!? I certainly didn't see it coming.However, after the first two minutes this movie suddenly becomes goofy to the point of ridiculousness. The surviving Brody's decide to jet off to the Bahamas to get away from this vengeful shark...(lol) and this is when the goofyness sets in...this super shark swims basically at 400mph following the plane making the trek from New England to the Bahamas in time to catch its breathe and beat the plane there. INstead of a homing pigeon we have a homing Shark a remarkably personal one at that. Seriously this film was one step away from the shark climbing out of the water and getting a charter plane to the Bahamas.We are introduced to Mario Van Peebles character 'ya mon' and his sublime acting skills in tackling a Jamaican accent. If this film was to be taken semi serious, it would be mildly insulting in its stereotyping- but this is the least of this films worries. When we see the shark in action you can see the mechanics in its mouth at times and the the little railing it goes along on the sea bed!!! Seriously check it out! Remarkable. It also seems to possess selective speed, it swims from the US to the Caribbean faster than a plane but it can't catch Mario Van Peebles...go figure. We see a disastrously hammy effort from Michael Caine post Oscar winning perfroance, supposedly Mrs Brody's love interest. Incidentally she seemed to get over Martin Brody's heart-attack pretty fast. However i digress, there is one scene where Caine gets attacked in his plane in the water, and the rubber shark supposedly eats him. Yet INexplicably and quite hilariously Caine's character swims and climbs onto the boat everyone else is on where he's washed, completely dried, and without a mark on him. His reaction to being attacked by this shark 'wow, it had bad breathe' seriously, this is no joke...there is no way you can take this film seriously. The climax is...i laugh at the prospect of recollecting it...Mrs Brody now very annoyed that this vengeful shark, interrupted her holiday and transported Michael Caine unharmed; sets off to beat this shark once and for all...now apparently she was aided by this mechanical device which sent electric waves from the boat on to the shark because suddenly this fish begins to flap about on its fins hovering above water...and roaring...again i kid you not... i didn't know a shark could roar either. Anyway, this shark continued to hover above water long enough for Brody to cunningly control her boat and ram the shark with the bow of the boat and stab it in the belly to kill it.Despite the fact that is hugely implausible the best is yet to come, she has flash backs to things which happened in the original which she wasn't there to witness...yet she steers the boat right into its chest and the shark blows up...seriously it blows up! But the realms of implausability had already been tested by the safe transportation of Michael Caine after being eaten; swimming faster than a jet plane; having a personal agenda against a human family; plus it takes Mario van Peebles by the head, but don't worry he survives in the end as well...so i guess a roaring shark hovering above water and blowing up from being stabbed is not any more unlikely than the atrocities committed by the director in this film! A truly awful film, but enjoyable if you want to laugh at the ridiculousness of the whole movie.
