reviews.review_title: Premise is terrible but, execution is not bad
reviews.content: Let me state the obvious to begin. The idea of a shark having a personal grudge against a certain family is crazy. How would the shark even know who is a Brody and who isn't? That being said, I enjoyed it a lot more than I expected. While the idea is silly, the actual story of some of the Brody family being scared that a shark is targeting them is preformed pretty well. The action scenes with the shark are so much better than the third movie and are not far behind the second. I enjoyed all the nods to the first movie and felt it was just enough without dwelling on the past. The ending is alright until you get to the moment of the shark's demise which really doesn't make sense. From what I understand the original ending made a lot more sense even though it's still far fetched.I realize that few will probably agree with my opinion but, I don't think this movie deserves the low rating it has. It is no classic but, it's a decent enough movie if you get past cringing a little whenever the "the shark is out to get us" statements are made. I think it still ends the franchise a good note and I'm personally glad the it didn't end with train wreck that was Jaws 3. I didn't expect to enjoy this movie very much but, I was pleasantly surprised.

Why, Why, Why did they make this movie for? Huh? It kills the Jaws series. The shark in this film looks like it came for a child's bathtub that only moves its mouth! That's the only movement I see in that shark! (and it roars like a lion or something like that) Gee come on. And it even swims in warm water! Wow! that shark is something! Huh! Even the story isn't that great either, Ellen Brody goes to the Barhamas after her son Sean is killed by the shark. The shark follows her there (Like I said that shark is something) its a smart shark! It starts stalking members of the Brody family. I still wonder why Michael Caine took this role! He's a great actor! It was a waste of film, time and money,(they even filmed it in 2:35:1). They should have stopped after Jaws 3! Avoid this movie at all costs, I wouldn't even hire it out for a buck!
I mean it. Just no.It is horrible.You will thank me later. It's for your own good.

My Rating:1/2 out of ****.In 1975, A Masterpiece was made, it was called Jaws. In 1978, Jaws 2 came out, it was good but not great. In 1983, it was Jaws 3-D, it was a guilty pleasure. Together these 3 would have made an uneven but decent trilogy. But no Hollywood is greedy and came out with Jaws 4. This film is one of the worst films of all time. Even the worst Halloween sequel (Part 6) cant compare to this.On the trivia area it is reported that the events in Jaws 3-D were ignored during the making of this film. I heard the filmmakers hated Jaws 3-D and ignored everything that happened. Jaws 3-D was not a great film at all, but most people would have to admit its better than this ridiculous piece of crap.The Shark in the films are not realistic at all. The model in the first was barely passable. However, Spielberg used the less is more technique to achieve suspense. Not much of the shark was shown but there was a great deal of Suspense. The shark is shown way too much here and it is fake looking as hell. Joseph Sargents does a terrible job at achieving suspense, ok there is no suspense. He is not Spielberg.The acting is horrible. Lorraine Gary overacts all the time. Michael Caine is wasted. Why is he in this film anyway? Mario Van Peebles is annoying.The way the Shark is killed is ridiculous and doesnt make sense. There is no way Lorraine Gary could take on the Shark by herself. She is not Sigourney Weaver, she is an old hag. The movie is consistently lame, everything scene is drenched with lameness. The flashbacks of the first movie have no purpose, just to block off the fact that the screenwriter had no idea how to kill off the Shark. I am surprised there is no Jaws 5. The Shark is supposed to be invincible and yet it looks like if you kick him he'll die.Yet for all that is terrrible about Jaws 4, the Ocean is beautiful looking. It looks great to swim in. Who cares about the Shark, check out the Ocean. The Carribean is beautiful. For those images I was able to give Jaws 4 half a star instead of zero.

This film is truly mind blowing. Oh yes, there is certainly no denying that. Why? Well that's simple. Because it's the biggest piece of crap excuse for a film that I have ever seen!!! The whole plot (???) is contrived, the shark looks more fake than in the prequels, and as if SEA WORLD weren't an unlikely enough target (#3) now the target is anyone in the Brody family!!! This is NOT Jaws!!!Jaws stands as one of the most memorable and excellent films of all time. And Jaws 2 is a great sequel. I refuse to count the last two films as part of the series at all. Actually, I like to pretend they were never made. Here are some things I really hated about this film:1) Horrible directing-  No one's gonna top Spielberg's astounding direction in the first film, but Jeannot Szwarc did a great job following it with Jaws 2. This film has some really awkward cuts, and it just doesn't feel right. The style is not as tense.2) Fake attack scenes-  In Jaws 1 and 2, attacks are barely shown if at all. There are sounds, splashing, and some blood. But in this film, we see graphic death scenes. Not only that, but the shark leaps from the water and somehow suspends itself in the air???3) Shark looks MORE fake-  You'd think that the animatronics would have improved from the earlier versions. Wrong. The shark in this version looks different and frankly much more unrealistic than in 1 and 2. It also GROWLS... Come on people! I am still baffled by how the effects of Jaws 1 and 2 were achieved, but this film just makes me laugh.4) Plot???-  I've already mentioned this, so I'll be brief... Uhhhh,no. Just, no.5) The Music Sucked-  Jaws 1 and 2 were both accompanied by the wonderful compositions of John Williams. Not only is the Jaws theme memorable, but the other music in the soundtrack fits in perfectly with the action. You don't see much, but you can certainly hear the tension in the music, which is scarier. This movie barely even uses the main theme, and when it does it's in the wrong spots. Sometimes in this film, there is no music at all when there should be some. And the music there is is all cliche and overdone.6) Characters-  Even without the incredibly stereotypical African-Americans in this movie, the annoying child, and the really unfunny Brit, this film has no sympathetic characters. I could really care less about the life of Ellen Brody. I could care less about Michael and his conk research. And frankly, if I were anyone in this movie I'd want to be Sean so I could get out of there as quickly as possible so as to avoid the rest of this horrible movie. Basically, this movie has the same character problem that Jaws 3-D had- No Roy Scheider. Come ON! Once the Chief was no longer in the picture, the story ends. Martin is Jaws, Jaws is Martin. Who cares about everyone else???And last but not least....7) Atrocious Climax/Ending-  I don't even understand how this shark is supposed to have died. It went insane??? What is THAT??? He also got poked by a stick??? It was so incredibly stupid that I was just completely lost. And as if you couldn't tell how bad this ending was, just look to the fact that they had to rely on the climax of the FIRST film to make this one work! Actually, I'm glad they put this part in there. The best part of this movie isn't even from this movie. It's Roy Scheider's famous end scene from the first Jaws movie. Imagine that.All in all, I would not recommend this film to anyone, ESPECIALLY not to anyone who's a fan of the true Jaws films. Stick with 1 and 2.

reviews.review_title: An OK movie, but didn't need to be made
reviews.content: I enjoyed this movie a little bit but not the best in the series it doesn't have the same feel as the other jaws movies. However it isn't the worst movie I've ever seen and the fact that Mario van peebles character survived his attack was very unrealistic but it was a jaws movie. Probably the worst in the series but it was ok I guess.

reviews.review_title: Terrible end to the Jaws movies.
reviews.content:
This movie is ridiculous and should not be associated with Peter Benchley's Jaws.
The acting was appalling but perhaps the result of bad directing? Even the lovable Michael Caine should be ashamed of his performance.
On a technical note; some of the greeen-screening was bad.
On saying that, it did have an element of fun and some moments of high tension. Worthy of a watch but don't expect anything great.

The original Jaws was very good. Jaws 2 was adequate if a touch dull. Jaws 3 was completely ridiculous and already a film too far for this franchise, but Jaws 4 is a plain insult to movie fans. Michael Caine is one of Britain's best actors and a screen legend. However, in this he looks like a tired old veteran counting the days to retirement. The script is banal, the action scenes very poor indeed. Why the film was made is one of life's great mysteries, it really is! There is absolutely nothing to commend this film, its that bad. It's not even particularly funny, like so many other poor films are. Jaws 4 is just plain boring and not worth seeing. The standard of acting is impossibly terrible. This film could well have been directed by a bunch of drugged up hippo students, although a terminally ill parrot suffering extreme bouts of depression might have made a better fist of things! This film needs to be deleted from history NOW!

reviews.review_title: After killing their son a large Great White shark stocks the Brody family
reviews.content: Jaws: The Revenge was I thought a major disappointment for me. I like the original Jaws movie and the 2, and third one but I think this one went real down hill. Some of the effects were good for the time it was made, but not enough shark eats people scenes and thought it was just a waste of time. Jaws: The Revenge really is not a bad movie but most would not find it interesting at all. I really liked Roy Schnider in all the other Jaws movies and was sad to know he was not i Jaws: The Revenge. Some people might still like it, it stills has that "uh-oh here comes the shark" kind of style and the shark looks fairly impressive. All in all it was not that great of a movie.

reviews.review_title: Just when you thought it was safe to go back in the theater
reviews.content: wow.....wow....this movie left me dumbfounded. All questions rushed to my head like a fake shark puppet rushing for a bored Michael Caine: Who, What Where, How, Why, When? Who: Who in they're right mind thought up this crap??? What:What were they thinking? really!? Where:uh...well ok I don't have one for "where". How: How is it possible to make such a bad movie without really trying to make it deliberatly this bad? Why: I think it's self-explanatory When:Was it after Jaws 3 crashed and burned, or when they were high on drugs did they decide they could make some money off us with a moving picture like this? (not worthy of the word "movie") Well, I think everyone covered all the laughable flaws already, like the roaring, superintelligent, vengefull, anorexic, hovering, air-breathing, may I say fake looking shark (did I cover it all?) All I can say is the only thing truley scarier than this...THING, is the rumors of a Jaws 5. Actually, maybe this is a chance for the series to redeem itself. Probably not.

This is one of the worst films I have seen to date.  I gave it a "2" only because I actually made it through the entire movie.  The shark looks fake, the actors are terrible, it is a big mess.  If I remember correctly only the shark only takes out two people, when you want it to eat them all.  Counting the hair on your arm would be a better use of your time than watching this stinker.

...well, a whole hell of lot of fun!Jaws The Revenge............oh boy. Now here's a movie that's reputation has ALWAYS been in the toilet - and deservedly so. Jaws The Revenge is simply an insanely ridiculous and poorly made movie. THOUGH I must confess that it's something of a guilty pleasure of mine and I think you'll agree that most of it's entertainment value comes from the sheer implausibility of it's plot and the ridiculous scenarios that follow. Also take notice at just how utterly fake the shark looks this time around. Pitiful.Let's get the few good aspects of this movie out of the way early and since there are so few positive qualities it won't take long. The best thing about "Jaws: The Revenge" is obviously it's beautiful location photography, which takes place almost entirely in the Bahama's. No two ways about it, down in those tropical climes it's pretty much a paradise on Earth. Another excellent part of this movie is the sheer effectiveness of it's opening scene, it was simply staged in such a way (filmed at night), that it possesses a palpably evil and nasty edge - unlike all other action/attack scenes found later in the movie (this is in direct contrast to "The Banana-Boat Sequence", which makes up for it with it's enormous comedic value). So... Bahama's and opening chomp scene and that pretty much expends my legitimate compliments of the film. Because if you watch this movie I think you'll agree, that it's glaringly self-evident - Jaws: The Revenge is an incredibly bad movie.But I absolutely must say that this terrible movie is NOT without its charms and it has many and almost always for the wrong reasons, too. Now here comes the fun part, which is dissecting the the hilarious lunacy that is, Jaws 4 a.k.a. Jaws The Revenge (and man-alive does this flick give you a lot of material!). First things first, a most gifted shark, evidently Jaws now has the ability to read minds or at least that's what the utterly brilliant screen writers would have us believe. So don't forget to chalk up "Telepathic Perception" to Jaws' resume! Anyways, after losing her youngest son Sean, an aging and not so fresh Ellen Brody needs to "get away from it all" and so she hops on a plane and fly's to the Bahamian Islands, but of course Jaws obviously knows this and proceeds to make the long trek to the Bahama's, a distance of 1,195 miles (that's from the fictitious Amity Island, which is essentially Martha's Vineyard Massachusetts to the Bahama's). How long do you think it would take, for a great white shark to swim that distance? And if I'm remembering correctly, Jaws beats her down there! Very interesting physics isn't it. Not surprisingly the movie really drags badly when it doesn't directly involve the ocean (meaning Jaws) and Mario Van Peebles ridiculous cringe-worthy character certainly takes some getting used to and his voice is patently annoying indeed.The robotic shark effects, wow..... as far as the series goes, they are simply are at their WORST in the fourth film. The effects are an important aspect that you really would think would've gotten better with each film, however, the exact opposite happened. And that's particularly true with some scenes in the middle of the movie, where the shark looks utterly fake and completely static and please try to keep in mind, that the people who made this movie, are asking you to believe that what you are seeing is a marvel of evolution, a super-predator - a monstrous man-eating shark. Perhaps the films most entertaining and ridiculous sequence is when Jaws, a 25 foot long / 6,000 pound great white shark, chases Mike Brody into a sunken ship and then proceeds to navigate it's narrow underwater corridors almost as easily as a person would. And let us not forget Mikes "inspired escape", where once again, in a Jaws movie, air-tanks are just doing some CRAZY THINGS - admittedly however, it does look great on film. And what about The Bends/decompression sickness and all that??? Oh yeah, right, this is Jaws 4, so never mind.....The real victim of this movie has to be Michael Caine, he's the only actor among them who has/had anything of a successful film career. I guess Caine had some down times and this HAD TO BE one of them. He plays a middle-aged pilot, making a living flying sight-seeing tours and at the same time, is trying to get into Ellen Brody's pants (brave man). Near the end of this highly slip-shod affair is one of cinema's most glaring continuities, involving Michael Caine, who crashes his plane into the ocean, swims some 60 to 70 feet to a yacht and gets aboard with WET hair and DRY clothes?!?! Which leads us to the finale, evidently Jaws want's revenge so badly, that it's on a hell-bent collision course with the Brodies yacht. The scene is handled through a succession of quick cuts of Jaws/Brodies/Jaws/Brodies and is capped-off with one of the most ridiculously funny and comically clichéd slow-motion shots ever seen; which involves our steely heroine Ellen Brody letting loose a highly dramatic "NNNNNOOOOOOOOOOOOO!!!". Then Jaws slams head-first into the yacht, which, depending on what version you see, is very poorly depicted, showing nothing more than a broken bowsprit and a spray of red water. Awesomely anti-climatic.And wait - what's that! Is that Mario Van Peebles! Again!! WTF!!! Despite finding himself right in the jaws of the beast and was dragged several meters underwater, he somehow miraculously survives. Apparently he was saved by "test audiences", who inexplicably "liked him" (SMH).............. a nice sunny conclusion, I guess. Oh, this still isn't as bad as Jaws 3D.

For me to rate something 1/10 is highly unusual. The way I see it, 1/10 is as bad as it gets. And this movie is just that! I honestly don't think I have ever seen anything worse than this. I had the misfortune of watching this movie during a marathon. I decided to watch all the Jaws movies in one sitting because the original masterpiece by Spielberg made me curious.. I regret actually going through with it. Now I can't go back.. This disaster of a movie will forever be stuck in my head.. It will probably haunt my soul even after my death..Whoever made this: I hope you sleep well at night. I truly do...

JAWS: THE REVENGE - what can be said? How about all of it's flaws:--The shark that roars. --Michael Caine goes into the water and gets out....with a dry shirt!?!? --The cheap throwaway dialogue. --A traveling shark. --The bizarre dreams-? nightmares-? dreams within dreams? --No John Williams score... --No mention of Sea World or it's JAWS 3-D relations... --The fakest looking shark of the bunch. --The 2 endings -? This film is a bonafide mess....AND a true laugh riot. If you are ever in a BAD BAD mood - watch this film - you will laugh your ass off. This film makes you in a great mood and you could make a drinking game out of this one as well. When someone says something that is considered nonsense - DRINK. You'll be drunk within 20 mins!And let me finish by asking - why does the shark stay up above the water so long at the ending? That's not even scientifically possible. But then again is nothing featured in this UNIVERSAL STUDIOS release. You read that right - they funded this, approved the script, and released it - were they drunk?

Jaws 4 Bites. The worst of the series. First was Great. Second one was Good not great. The third one sucked. This one, Oh God, horrible. The shark roars in this one. Sharks don't roar. If I made a Jaws movie it would be a Trillion times better then this pile of crap. If you want a good Jaws movie(or movies) then watch Part 1 and 2, skip the rest. If I were you, I would avoid this one like the way Richard Simmons avoids women. Jaws: The Revenge is number 3 on my worst sequels list, and is number 6 on my worst movies ever made list. The death of the shark is retarded. This is probably one of my least favorite horror movies. We need to get this back in the Bottom 100, That is how bad this movie is. My overall rating for Jaws 4 is 1 out of 10 Roaring sharks. Thanks for reading my review.

Well, a fourth great white (though this one is only about ten feet long) follows a widowed Mrs. Brody to the Bahamas after killing her son. It appears as though this sea critter wants to wipe out the entire Brody family--despite the fact sharks aren't exactly known for having emotions. I don't want to reveal how the film ends (though I don't recommend seeing it anyway), but Mrs. Brody has a bunch of flashbacks from the ending of the classic original "Jaws" (despite the fact she wasn't at those scenes) and somehow saves the day. The whole film has little to do with a shark, but with Mrs. Brody's meloncholy state and mourning for her late husband (who supposedly died of a heart attack). Michael Cain wasted his time on this one...even the portrait of Roy Scheider (great actor, played Chief Brody in the first and second "Jaws" flicks) must be ashamed.

Far and away the worst film I`ve ever seen.This shark can fly, roar, chase aeroplanes and can infiltrate the mind of Chief Brody`s wife and yet is almost completely incapable of killing anyone.The film uses about 20 minutes of footage from the first film.  If that`s all they can do to make this interesting (just show the first one) it shows how crap this is.There must be a million things wrong with this film.  Far too many to list here anyway.  Having said that, whenever this film is on TV I always watch it for a laugh.

Who made this movie and what planet were they from? This is such an incompetent thriller, so horribly made, that I wonder if anyone involved in this film saw the original. What makes Jaws so great is the threat of the remorseless killer with no human compassion because it ain't human. As Dreyfuss describes it as "an eating machine, the perfect engine, a miracle of nature." The basis of this movie is so implausible - a shark hunting down its victims - that I was insulted. The ending has to be seen to be believed.I have two pieces of advice: First, avoid this at all cost. Second, read Roger Ebert's review of this movie on his web site. You can link there from the IMDb. It is one of his best and completely sums up this dreadful film. 1/2* out of ****.

Yes, Jaws the Revenge is cheesy and bad, BUT it is still somewhat watchable at 2 in the morning when you are bored and nothing else is on. I think Lorraine Gary is a great actress, actually. So is Lynn Whitfield. I do agree the little girl, Thea, is annoying, but what makes the film BAD, is the shark itself. I don't recall anything as fake looking as that pathetic thing they try to pass off as a shark in this film. I know they probably didn't have a big budget for this, but still, in all honesty, if the shark hadn't been so silly looking and do things that sharks don't do (roar, roll on side, stand on tail!, etc) then it would be more tolerable. At least the DVD is in widescreen...

reviews.review_title: I'd give it zero stars if I could
reviews.content: God imagine letting a little girl ride on a boat even though they know a shark is out there but I'm sorry but that's ludcrious . You just know someone was going to be eaten .

Really, words cannot describe just how bad this film is. The plot makes absolutely no sense, the acting is hard to watch, the special effects are a joke, the and ending is possibly one of the worst endings to any movie ever made anywhere.I'm at a loss to understand why; Michael Caine would agree to be in this drek They didn't think to actually hire a script writer to produce a plot that made at least a little bit of sense.Whoever owns the move rights to JAWS allowed this abomination to happen.Who funded this thing? And finally, what did the rest of us do to the people that made this piece of crap that they thought we deserved being subjected to this movie? This movies isn't even fun to watch in a kind of drunken Mystery Science Theatre setting, it's just that bad. watching it makes you lose all hope for humanity.In case you're not getting the gist here; it's a galactically horrible movie...

I didn't even think this movie existed for the longest time. Surely after the farce that was Jaws 3D no one in their right minds would try to milk this concept any further, right? Wrong. Jaws 4 "The Revenge" is a jumbled mess of ideas that only a person on a raging coke binge would have thought as passable material. Are there any redeemable qualities to this movie? No. Michael Caine was the lone hope in this movie, and gets terrible lines and looks generally bored with whatever is going on. Lorraine Gary is in this movie because her husband owned the studio that produced it, and she comes across as a crazy widow who at this point should honestly be committed to a mental institute. The shark is shown very early and very often, and to call it laughable would be the understatement of the movie. It is amazing that I can't tell whether the terrible CGI shark in Jaws 3D or the terrible mechanical shark in "The Revenge" is worse. In the end, it doesn't matter. The story is incoherent and boring with very little tension or suspense. The characters are bland and forgettable while being played by actors who either took this movie too lightly or too seriously. The effects in this movie are something that a college student could come up with. No redeeming qualities in a movie that is a blatant cash cow. I wouldn't even call this a good movie to riff on, because it is just so boring.

Jaws: The Revenge (1987) is a horror thriller film directed by Joseph Sargent, the film was released summer in 1987, and is the last series of Jaws movie franchise. Over the years, Michael and Sean no longer work at Sea World. Michael now has a new life, and Sean lives with his mother after the death of his father (Martin Brody) who suffered a heart attack, but on Christmas Eve, Tragedy again Occurred. Sean who works as a cop succeeds his father. Killed by 28 white sharks, it turns out the shark is hunting the Brody family. The shark wants revenge! ... Will the Brody Family be able to defeat the shark ???? Jaws: The Revenge I watched his movie a few minutes ago via DVD media. This 89-minute movie feels so boring, at the beginning of a movie that is so tragic, but after its just silliness .. Sharks take revenge ??? Ohh no longer .. The effect of white sharks in this film is so stiff and bad .. Unlike in his first film White shark effect in the movie Jaws (1975) is very realistic, and not like a robot .....

Giving this film 1 star is too much praise. The unrealistic premise and the poorly written story is not what baffles me the most about this film, but the fact that someone thought this was a good idea and that it was actually made into a movie. "Jaws: The Revenge" is about the widow of the hero of the first and second "Jaws" films, Chief Brody, who believes another great white shark is around, this time focusing it's efforts on taking out the entire Brody family because of the three sharks killed in the past. With an unbelievably dumb premise, this film, even after the failure of "Jaws 3", causes the "Jaws" franchise to jump the shark further(rim shot). If it is not asinine enough that the shark is out for revenge for three fallen sharks that it never knew or if it did, did not know they were dead, it somehow knows it was the Brody family that killed the sharks and who is a family member and who isn't. This film just has such a bad premise and plot that the scariest thing in the film is not the shark, but the fact that any actor would agree to this hunk of schlock.

reviews.review_title: Is it possible to give a movie a 0 rating?
reviews.content: This is one of those movies that convinces you that studio heads really don't know what they are doing, that it's all a big crapshoot. It's hard to believe that someone looked at the treatment for Jaws 4 and said, "Yeah, this is a good idea. Let's go with this."A real head-shaker.

JAWS THE REVENGE may be the most laughable excuse for a movie I have ever seen.  In this (hopefully) final entry, Ellen Brody visits her son Mike, now married with a young daughter, in the Bahamas.  But little does she know that the shark that killed her other son has followed her and starts attacking people, including her grand-daughter.  JAWS 3-D was bad enough, but at least that one had cool effects.  There is nothing good about this one.  At all.  The effects are so cheap that they make SUPERMAN IV look like TITANIC, and the thrill is gone.  Very, very laughable.0 out of 5

reviews.review_title: Come on people it wasn't that bad!
reviews.content: I actually enjoyed this movie very much and don't understand why so many people hate it, if you think this is the worst horror movie made I suggest you go watch The Blair Witch Project. I swear some of the reviews on here sound like a bunch of whining teenagers! Anyways, alot of you say that a shark can't make noises or jump out of the water, but you are WRONG, this girl has seen enough of Shark Week on The Discover Channel to know that they do in fact jump out of the water, just last week i was watching a special about Great Whites and one jumped out of the water like a dolphin NO JOKE! and I have heard one roar, it may not have been as loud as the one in the movie but it did roar. So if you want to insult a movie you could at least get your facts right. I would love to see a Jaws 5 in the future.

reviews.review_title: "Jaws" was never meant for a sequel!
reviews.content: What could be more common than Hollywood making sequels to very successful movies? If it was successful and earned us money then a sequel must be made. In other words the aim is not so much to entertain as to make a quick buck! Jaws was simply not fit for a sequel. The shark dies in the first film. Bringing a new one along just to terrorize Amity once again is so stupid an idea that one wonders how did they come up with it, the weirdest part being that no resident of Amity seems to ask him/herself "why is it that great whites have a thing for our island?" Having Brody's wife assume that the shark came for them is so dumb, it actually insults our intelligence as an audience since we are supposed to buy that load of garbage.The thing that struck me the most about the revenge is the final water sequence when they've killed the shark,(by driving a boat into it! Don't make me laugh) the horizon backdrop is obviously a painting. It's so obvious it physically hurts since even the water splashes against it! How are we supposed to not notice something that's literally thrown at our face. I'm sure most of you who've seen the film know exactly what I am talking about.It seems that Universal has quite forgotten what constitutes a good sequel. Robert Shaw (Quint in the original Jaws) suggested that they make a movie about him on the Indian outpost in World War 2 (see his monologue in the first film) where a bunch of sharks ate many of his army buddies. This could have made a good sequel since it's unique and quite possible. But no! Universal had other plans. They'd rather show us a group of stupid kids trying to get away from a shark with Brody's son with them (of course, great whites never forget!)In the revenge the studio has taken its overwhelming stupidity to the next level. A shark eats Helen Brody's son and then another shark hunts her and her second son in the Bahamas. As the poster says: This time it's personal. Indeed it is. The great white sent a message to his buddy in the Bahamas asking him to do some killing on his behalf and obviously he agrees. This friend of the great white is apparently some kind of X shark due to the fact that he is blessed with vocal cords that enable him to roar (maybe its mother mated with a lion) and has another extraordinary ability to stand on water. So he is an X super shark. I can't believe I bought the damn DVD. But anyway it serves a completion purpose. I'd like to finish this article by making a film suggestion to Universal pictures and Hollywood. You seem to be so into making sequels and prequels e.g Saw3, The Texas chainsaw massacre:The beginning, why not make a 5th Jaws? "Jaws: The return of the great white", where the shark gets cloned by modern day technology and is then free to continue his hunt for the descendants of the Brody family. Sounds stupid? What do you care as long as it makes money we are all happy and we do't give a damn about quality.

Wow. This movie is so insanely stupid that I don't know where to start. How about this... Universal is going to take an incredibly great movie classic and destroy it with idiotic sequels! Brillient! Sure, it may have grossed its budget, but thats all this movie was made to do. Its objective was to milk the American people out of more money. I read here on IMDb.com, that Jaws: The Revenge had a budget of 23 Million dollars. Give me 1/16th of that budget and I'm positive that I could make a better film. 1.Sharks cannot roar. 2.Sharks cannot stand on their tails. 3. When sharks are impaled with large sticks they do not automatically explode. 4.Mama Brody cannot reminisce about things she didn't witness. 5.Sharks cannot follow people vast distances. 6.Sharks do not enjoy swimming in warm bahaman waters. 7.Michael Caine shouldn't be in this movie. 8.Sharks do not have feelings. I could really go on forever there. I enjoyed Jaws 2, its not a bad film. Jaws 3 is laughable, but still holds up. Jaws: The Revenge is simply a steaming heap of movie making feces. Judging by the cinematography alone (revealing the inner workings and external moving parts of the extremely fake hunk of plastic thats supposed to be a shark) the director gives Bruno Mattei a run for his money. Do not buy or even rent this piece of cinematic garbage, unless you want to have a good laugh.

This film was o.k. it has a lot to do with Steven Spielberg's first film and The second film as well. Michael Broady returns from his disaster at sea world to find that Ellen Broady Wife of Chief Broady [ Roy Sincder ]  that his brother Sean has been killed by a shark. But what ever happened to old mayor Murray Hamilton and how dose Ellen Broady see her husband kill the shark from the first film and see Robert Shaw get killed also from the first film in her mind when she was not present at the time. Well it is preety good but silly that the shark roars and stands on it's tail. Starring: Lorriane Gary, Michael Caine, Lance Guest, Mario Van Peebles, Lee Ferrio [ from the first film as Mrs. Kintner] and they should have returned Richard Dreyfuss. RATED PG-13.

Normaly there is the intention to make a more spectaculair and a enjoyable continuation of the story the previous movies had layed out. Everybody liked the first "Jaws" movie, people where affraid to go in the water even, and because it's great succes a second part was understandable.Jaws 2 wasn 't as good as the first, but still a good movie. I wished that they ended the "jaws" movies after that one! Where the first two movies where of the same quality Visually, that quality was long gone in the third Jaws movie if you ask me.The first movie was the worlds first introduction with the big shark, the second movie lost that element of surprise, it's still an exciting movie, and there is nothing wrong with the story line or the ending. And the formula for succes was being the first to send shiffers down peoples spines in fear of a "realistic" monster, where before movies like "godzilla" or "king-kong" were scary in there own ways, but didn't make people go home in fear of a gigantic lizards. The film makers must had the same conclusion about the "succes formula" so to get that element of surprise back they thought "let's go bigger, more action and more extreme. I agree that it was the only option IF jou want to make a decent new jaws movie. "IF" because my opinion is that they gone overboard with the third movie. It lacked te same "feel" as the previous movies, the "new for it's time" but looking ridicilous (special effect) shark attack scènes and a big, bad and bloody script that left nothing to the imagination. So they must have made a bunch of money with that third one but i rather saw it never being made.Than now finally the movie where my whole story began with. Jaws 4 ..... again they had the same conclusion as me, bigger en bloodier is not going to be the way they must have thought.So...sadly...they made another movie, and they must have thought, let's go back to basic. And let's use that , "first a few deaths, than in fear and doubt, to end with a all or nothing fight to the Death" script and maybe a surprise survivor at the end or something, people love that. I'm gonna stop because i'm getting grey hairs of frustation. Only reason that people start this movie is the word "Jaws" in the title.CONCLUSION: If jou want to see a predictable, boring "jaws light" this is your movie. What seperates this movie from the other ones except the title and the fact that it's a soft version of the first two movies.......ehhh...one of the lead actors is black. BTW SPOILER ALERT: the shark dies.

OMG this has to be the worst film of the 20th century...in fact it is. What a shame and insult to the brilliant Jaws that came out in 1977. The first Jaws was truly terrifying from the opening scene to the final moment and you believed that such a thing could really happen. But this movie laughs at what film making is and has a contempt for the audience with its absurdity. A shark born from the first one that was killed comes back with revenge on its mind to get the family of the man that killed its mommy....I can't believe Lorrene Gary and Michael Caine were even a part of this project. In this film you have a shark that roars and can stand on its tail out of the water as it attacks people.This movie should be required viewing in film school on what crappy film-making is and what to avoid.

Two words sum up this debacle of a Jaws film: unintentionally hilarious!I concur with Gislef's review of this film (another reviewer in imdb). This was a bad film. It's in the ballpark of Plan 9 in the sense of bad plotting. Frankly, if you watch Jaws the Revenge as a comedy, it's one of the funniest movies you'll ever see. Unfortunately, it wasn't filmed or marketed that way.My favorite parts: Jaws swimming down the coast and trailing the family from Bermuda to the Bahamas (or whereever the heck this film is set); Mario Van Peebles appearing virtually unscathed after being ostensibly crushed in the jaws of Jaws; Michael Caine landing his plane in the water and then swimming later to the boat (the boat didn't look as though it was designed for water, and I found it hard to believe that a) he could survive the crash and swim to the surface and b) he'd destroy an expensive piece of aircraft).

Words cannot describe how bad this film is...but to spare you all from watching this goddawful film i will do my best to summarise what i have just seen! That naughty shark ruins everyones christmas by chewing up the younger of the Brody boys leaving his angst ridden mother to jet off to the bahamas to get over the shock..her eldest son Michael..is a marine biologist..an unlikely occupation from a man whose had a less than friendly childhood with the sea...however it all turns pear shaped when the shark turns up in the bahamas hell bent..we are meant to believe(!?) on revenge on its predecessors untimely deaths at the hands of Chief Martin Brody..the aforementioned husband and father of said characters! The effects for this movie are truly dreadful..the shark has never looked so utterly fake and..it roars!!???...the acting is also below average..with Lorraine Gary reprising her role from the original two movies and she virtually carries the film on her own..well padded shoulders..as those around her flounder helplessly..Michael Caine apparently did this film just for the money and in order to build a nice house..in one sequence he manages to escape from a sinking plane..swim to a boat..climb aboard..all without getting his shirt wet..AMAZING and possibly the best special effect on show...other supporting cast members arent really worth mentioning..and i will spare the little girl who played Thea the child actress Judith Barsi..who tragically died shortly after filming was completed! As far as this film goes..i implore you to watch the first two movies..skip the 3rd..and to AVOID THIS ONE AT ALL COSTS!!

reviews.content: When Jaws came out in 1975 I saw the movie at least 6 times in the theater. It is a true classic. I saw JawsII and it didn't have the magic of the original but it was OK as sequels go.  Jaws III was a mess. But this movie is total crap. Who could have believed that that great movie from the summer of 75' would mutate into Jaws: The Revenge. The premise stunk, the actors stunk, the shark stunk. Nothing more can  be said.

Jaws the Revenge is crap, it has no story line, no plot, no good characters, and I wish that the little girl Thea had got eaten, sadly she did not. Only 2 people were killed, when the whole cast should have been eaten alive. Well I guess Next time I go on holiday I will travel by Rubbershark Airways.A 1 and a half out of 10

reviews.review_title: Everything has been said but we must say it all again
reviews.content: "This movie sucks"  "I hate this movie" "i can't believe what i just saw" Typical reviews to this stupidity parade called Jaws: The Revenge.  And the sad thing is it's all understandable.  I still HATE this movie, so much! I'm like Burce Wayne, even after avenging his parents death the rage and fight is still there.  Even after writing an argession filled review three years ago, i still have to come back here every few months to read these same reinforcing hate filled reviews.  Because no matter how many times a reviewer points out that a SHARK stands on its tail and roars my head can never fathom the earth-shattering stupidity of it all.  Bruce Wayne will never get his parents back, I will never get my 90 minutes back, and the scar left on the name of a groundbreaking piece of cinema will never heal.I'll forgo the instinctual impossibility that a shark would camouflage himself near a piece of driftwood to eat a person on a boat rather than just swim up and eat another fish.  I'll forgo the logistical impossibility that a shark fearing widow would flee her island home to ANOTHER ISLAND!  As I type this I just watched today's best NHL goaltender come out of his zone, drop his stick and let an open ice puck crawl right between his legs for a goal in the Stanley Cup finals.  So people make stupid mistakes in times of pressure, I'll forgive you Ms. Brody, just as I forgave Mr. Brodeur. After all what brings more pressure than a telepathic, reborn, teleporting, roaring, exploding, vengeful predator of the seas? I'll even forgo the physical impossibility of surviving the bends.This ending, although cannot be forgiven by Jesus Christ himself. The last twenty minutes is just an unbelievable orgy of every irrational idea conceived by filmmakers.  There was a method behind Spielberg's exiting finale in 1975.  He said that by that point he "has his audience." After taking them on this thrilling yet conceivable ride, that for just a few seconds they would suspend their beliefs and allow a great white to swim around chewing on an oxygen tank.  Well he was right.  Maybe the makers of Jaws: The Revenge had a reverse plan...  maybe their plan was to constantly bombard you with inconceivable acts of stupidity and impossibility until you are rendered retarded from the whole ordeal so when they unleash a plethora of insanity at the climax you barely realize it.Can there be any other excuse for a shark to walk on its hind fins, roar, catch a man in his razor sharp mouth in slow motion, let him survive, get poked by a stick, and explode!?  Ok let us look at this systematically. A shark on its hind fins:  Maybe they were trying to out-do the original scene where Bruce capsizes the Orca.  "Well a shark lunging out of the water to surface onto an already half-sunken, half decaying boat is pretty amazing.  Let's do something really amazing!"  Too much of a good thing, no wonder this is a sequal.  And what they can't "improve" on from the original, they just steal.  Just random scenes of the original thrown in the movie, as if to say "Hey, she's saying the same thing her husband said while fighting a shark, what a great example of.." bullshit! it's pointless and only reminds me of what film I SHOULD be watching!  And she's not heroically surviving one last face to face battle with the predator armed with only a rifle.  She's on a huge boat with all her surviving friends and family about to poke the gravity defying fish that's wearing some flash cube.  Not exciting at all, it's pathetic! Two last comments before I finish...  why would they make the shark roar? I suppose the filmmakers knew they weren't gifted enough to make a giant hungry silent eating machine about to attack be scary, so they made it roar to add "a scary sound effect."  You know in slasher movies when they just make a nail-on-chalkboards sound whenever the murderer pops out?  That kind of cheap garbage.  But they can't have someone just scream, or have a loud wave crashing sound.  No, it has to be this insanely thoughtless roar. Finally, the explosion.  Have you ever seen that Simpsons gag where something clearly stable and inflammable like a shopping cart crashes and explodes?  That satirical gag is EXACTLY what this movie pulls, and wants you to seriously accept it!  Try to think about that fact logically for more than a minute and don't blame me when you regain consciousness.  To see something like this even referred to as a serious idea is inconceivable for even half a second!Well, as I finish this review, the Devils paid for their mistake and lost the game.  So that piled on all these horrible factors that equal Jaws The Revenge, i must retire before i simply throw my computer out the window. To conclude, I hate this movie, you should hate this movie.  And it is NOT healthy to imagine Spielberg making a sequel to "save" this franchise. It should have never been a franchise anyway.  It was a wonderful suspenseful work of art about nature, fear, and survival; and now the name is synonymous with monumental acts of stupidity and ridiculousness.  Please, enough damage has been done.

reviews.review_title: Unbelievable and not in a good way.
reviews.content:
All reviews for this film can be summed up through a single quote from Michael Caine who starred in the film:
" I have never seen it, but by all accounts it is terrible. However, I have seen the house that it built, and it is terrific!"

Well for one, I did not think Jaws 4 was that bad. I saw it when it was released in theaters, and even though I was young, I did understand a few things. But I also did not understand a few things. Such as the flashbacks to places not witnessed by Ellen. I also had questions on the intelligence and mobility of the shark. But that aside, I felt this movie was not that bad. It had quirky dialogue, fun characters and funny situations. If you can locate it, I recommend seeing the alternate version with Jake surviving (although why the shark and boat explode in this ending is beyond me). Anyway, give a view for fun.

This movie is horrible.  I laughed so hard while reading klatsdrawkcab's review (perfectly stated and good review) but not as hard as I laughed watching this movie.  The only thing the producers actually did right was to bring back the Brody family.  Jaws, now a 'family' of evil possessed sharks, are bent on killing everyone in the Brody family and evidently just won't stop until the job is done.  Anyhow, it was good to see Mrs. Brody back in this film, much older now, from the first two Jaws movies. 
But I just hated the fake shark!  And this movie more than either of the first two movies showed so many extended shots of it.  Why show something that sucks and is going to take away from the suspense (see my review of Jaws II for more on this).   The picture is clearer in this movie than in the others - because it was done the most recent. The Brody boy is all grown up in this movie.  He's afraid of sharks since he was terrorised as a kid by one in the second movie.  The movie shouldn't have spent so much time with his psychological problems with sharks - I really miss the strong roll Roy Scheider had in killing the shark in the first two movies.  He wasn't afraid of it and wimp out every time the shark got near!

Ellen Brody finds herself reliving the horrors of the past when a mammoth shark kills her youngest son. Grief-stricken, she travels to the Bahamas where she meets a carefree pilot. But the terror of the deep returns and Ellen must set out a final showdown to the death.This film starred: Lorraine Gary, Lance Guest & Michael CaineThis is the 4th and final installment in the JAWS franchise and in my opinion it is the worst one not by far because the 3rd one isn't great but I do think it is better than this as the plot to this film is bad, I just like the action in this film. I don't really recommend this film but if you are interested check it out.***/***** Could be worse.

reviews.review_title: More boring than The Star Wars Holiday Special
reviews.content: I had heard this was a terrible film, so watched it to see if it was so-bad-it's-good. It isn't, the reason for its low rating is simple: it is incredibly boring. There's a very brief moment of action early on, then nothing for about an hour. This would be fine if the writing was strong enough to support a dialogue-driven film, however all the lines are dull and uninteresting. Even when the shark attacks, it can feel boring due to over-use of slow motion. This is why I'm giving it a 3, because I reserve the one and two star reviews for films so poorly constructed that they become fun to watch. This will simply make you wait for it to end.

reviews.review_title: Not the best in the series but.......
reviews.content: JAWS the revenge was released in 1987 and, as a huge fan of the JAWS series could not wait to see it...... How disappointed I was !! It is unbelievable that a major film studio can invest so much money and talent in a film like this and make such a botch job of it !! Lorraine Gary puts in a string performance as the now widowed Ellen Brody (Roy Scheider sensibly kept his distance after JAWS 2). Lorraine Gary is an excellent (and underused) actress. Michael Caine is OK as the maverick pilot Hoagie - He seems to be enjoying himself(and the free trip to the Bahamas where most of this picture was shot). The actual shark is the worst in the series - you can often see the mechanics working the shark and when it is shown "swimming" in the water it just seems to be "bobbing up & down". The ending of the film Just makes no sense whatsoever and is ludicrous. On the plus side - The musical score by Michael Small is excellent and the photography is also impressive. I have bought this film on both Video & DVD - To complete my collection. Over the years I have actually "warmed" to it - but it will go down in cinema history as one of the weakest film sequels of all time.

This is one of the films that's so bad that it is good.. This must be one of the WORST movies ever.. but if you're in for a good laugh .. see it. It is pretty funny!! Our SuperShark here is superintelligent, can walk on water, is superfake, and blows up if you drive a boat into it!! or shoot it with the same bullet as from the first (Spielberg's masterpiece JAWS , which is VERY VERY GOOD) i don't know which of the items, the boat or the bullet killed it.. but hey.. it is still fun!! I'm not even sure if it died.. maybe they used the same scene as from JAWS 1?? it looked like it..and Michael Caine.. what on earth are you doing here? Are you broke or bored or both?..0/10 ..

OK, we have a shark out for revenge against the Brody family. Something tells me that the shark had a private investigator noting the movements of the Brody family and relaying them to the shark. - Sound stupid? Well, yes, but so is the film and if/when you see it you'll know what I'm on about.The Plot: Sean Brody has to go out at night and detach a bit of driftwood from a buoy. As he attempt to do this, his arm is bitten off. He sits in the boat screaming to the land for help but they're busy rehearsing music for Christmas and can't hear him. As he's leaning (rather stupidly considering what's just happened) over the edge of the boat shouting for help, he's munched - tasty! Anyhoo, Ellen Brody has the feeling that the shark is hunting down her family and goes out to the Bahamas to stay with her other son, his wife and his daughter. While there Michael Brody and his partner Jake are tagging snails when they discover a huge great white shark which quickly tries to attack Michael - see what I mean about the P.I? So, Jake and Michael try keeping track of the shark and when Ellen's granddaughter is attacked by the shark she decides she's going to go and try and kill it, and thus we get a stupid ending. Mario Van Peebles (Jake) is out on mast sticking out the front of the boat, sticks something in the sharks mouth but goes in as well sideways and the front mast breaks as Jake's dragged bleeding underwater. Michael's then using an electric charge to drive the shark crazy, Ellen Brody steers the broken front mast straight into the shark as it rises out the water due to the shock Michael gives it and the shark explodes. Yes, that's right. When you stab a shark with a sharp piece of wood it explodes. Oh, and Jake survives. The shark let him go because, as Jake says "Sharks only like white meat!" This is a very stupid, crap Jaws film, basically. What more can I say? I think I've given enough above for you to make up your mind. Mario Van Peebles is the best actor in it, shame he had to be in such a crap film.2 or 3 out of 10 As always, Cat §quire

reviews.review_title: It's not safe in the water or the theatre.
reviews.content: I may be very severely confused here. What shark is this? That's one of the many questions I had well watching this picture. Nothing makes sense, and this film is not only a bad one, but It's also a stupid and incompetent one. 3D failed to save "Jaws 3," and now we have "Jaws: The Revenge."It's about Ellen Brody (Lorraine Gary), now a widow, who is still living on Amity Island. Her son, Sean (Mitchell Anderson), is now the Chief of Police and one night, is eaten by a shark. Ellen becomes convinced that a great white is targeting her family, and she flees to the Bahamas with her other son, Mike (Lance Guest), a marine biologist. Ellen begs him to give up his job, but he tells her there has never been a shark in warm waters. Mike discovers the shark has swum from Amity Island and attempts to keep it a secret from his mother as he tracks it. Ellen discovers the shark has followed her, and she sets out to destroy it once and for all.If that plot sounded stupid, you're right. The tagline reads, "This time it's personal," like we are supposed to believe that a shark has a vendetta against Ellen. You can hear those sharks plotting their revenge. "Jaws 3" was terrible, but this picture is worse and about as bad as you can get for a story, characters, screenplay, cinematography, editing and a shark. A plot centring around a woman and a shark feuding make no sense, but a shark that swims three days from Amity to the Bahamas to find Ellen is beyond stupid.It opens on a Christmas night, where Sean gets tasked with fixing a buoy in the channel marker. He drives the boat out and gets attacked by a shark. Now, this scene is stupid for a few reasons. There is a children's choir singing Christmas carols in the background, and I'm supposed to believe they don't see him? Second, how does the shark know where Sean is going to be? Did the shark plan the whole scene? I'm fine if I don't learn the answers. Once Sean is eaten, Ellen has to be convinced to move to the Bahamas. Her son just died and, afterward, she is happy as a clam and Mike, seriously, has to persuade her to go with him. How touching! You know she would have stupidly stayed on that island. Once Ellen reaches the Bahamas, she begins to fall in love with a carefree pilot named Hoagie (Michael Caine), and Mike becomes jealous of this for some reason, a subplot we do not get an answer to, but that's fine.Speaking of Mike, he works as a Marine Biologist, of course, he does. Wouldn't you know it the shark has followed them? Instead of telling his mother, he keeps it a secret and attempts to study it. "How do sharks swim for three days and track a widowed mother?" I'm sure you can tell that I'm making fun of the film because it hasn't even got to the worst scenes yet.Ellen's fears are shown with the cheap "dream sequence," not once but twice. Ellen wakes up covered in sweat, fearing the shark is going to get her in a dream. This sequence is a cheap gimmick that irritates more than anything. Mike and his crew get attacked by the shark, and he ends up swimming for his life when he stupidly goes into the water to try and find it. He begins to believe his mum's theory that the shark is targeting the family. The shark looks so bad and fake. It looks like a rubber bag that floats side by side. Its head looks like a blown-up puppet with a lot of plastic-looking teeth. Somehow, the shark can break through a steel wall underwater before, with what clearly shows, someone operating its mouth.Somehow, Ellen can feel when the shark is about to attack someone. Yeah, and I'm the Easter Bunny. Someone is about to get attacked, and Ellen stops dead in her tracks on the beach with Hoagie before she shrugs it off. What? I was confused here more than I was when you see the shark's point of view. The camera makes it, so it looks like its eyes are above the water. One of the many errors of the movie, but that's not the best one. When Ellen finally sees the shark, the hunt is on. I do believe at this point, Ellen and the shark have something real, and they must fight it out at sea. Remember, it's personal! She commandeers a boat and sails out alone into the ocean to sacrifice herself to the shark to stop the madness. Oh boy! Hoagie manages to crash land his airplane so he can rescue Ellen. After being almost eaten, he climbs aboard with a freshly dry shirt after being in the water. Has this movie made any sense to you yet?Did you know that Sharks can also roar loud too? They try to bait it by using some electronic beeper box that drives it insane with rage, and it lets out this shrieking roar as it lifts itself above the water. Somehow, the shark can stand on its tail before being rammed by the boat. No really, straight up on its tail. I'm also wondering why there are flashbacks before the shark blows up in a sequence where there is a crucial shot missing. It's so incompetent that there is no establishing shot either. As they get closer to the shark, it's roar because louder, and they use the same camera shot three times over before It explodes, and we can finally leave the theatre. You may notice I used the word "Somehow" a lot. That's because everything in this picture is a question mark that eventually we don't care about, and if they make a "Jaws 5," you can be sure it's not safe to go back to the theatre.

Is it just me, but are not only these movies getting worse, but so are the effects.  Didnt effects improve over 12 years between Jaws and Jaws 4?  If this movie had a 23 million dollar budget, where did it go? Caine? Bahamas filming locations? The construction of Universals Falls Lake in Hollywood? One good thing about this film would have to be Lorraine Gary's performance. She has a great presance in these films, and it is fun to watch her go after the shark.  But the story, effects, and supporting acting make this movie flat out ridiculous.

My God! What were you people thinking? Who authorized this piece of crap! The plot holes are insane? How does one remember something only their husband witnessed? How does a shark get revenge? How does a shark know how to stand up on it's tail and roar? How does a shark swim over 15 miles to track someone? How did the Jamaican guy get bitten by the shark and yet only end up living with only a slightly bloody shirt? The acting is crap. Michael Caine gave up an Oscar for this? DAMN YOU!!! Also, to anyone seriously contemplating making anymore shark attack movies, don't, just...don't.Bottom line: Go watch "Aliens" OR THE ORIGINAL FILM.

Okay Okay. Don't kill me on this, but this movie actually had some suspenseful moments, and good ones for that matter. However, the good points are faltered by the rest of the movie. In this whole movie, Ellen Brody thinks the great white that killed her son is after her. WHAT is that? No way can a shark just go after a certain person it doesn't like, especially if the person is someone that is related to the other person the shark just killed. In my opinion, she was insane. And Sean Brody losing his arm? THAT was stupid. He shoulda just died right then, but they had to freakin's extend that and dramatize it. This movie had way too much blood to be in a shark movie. Sure, I enjoy some blood, but when Sean loses his arm and there's all that blood, plain stupid. And most of the movie was a drama about a mother and her son anyways. I kinda enjoyed Mario Van Peeples as Jake, the Rastafarian scientist that was Michael Brody's partner. And of course, the black guy always dies. I knew he was going to die in the end. I think that Hoagie should've died when his helicopter crashed in the water. He was standing on the edge of his helicopter, the shark comes out of the water, digs his mouth into the helicopter, and yet he doesn't die? BS. I didn't like the kid very much. She was EXTREMELY annoying and in the way. The narrator was absolutely pointless in the beginning and was saying all this BS that had nothing to do with the movie. I mean it sorta made sense, but come on, it was dumb. Another BS. The ending. Totally unreal. No way can a fake looking shark jump out of the water and then the boat ram into it and impale it. It's impossible. The shark looks so fake anyways, it's not even funny. Oh, and another thing, great whites don't just swim into the Bahamas for revengeful purposes. Besides, it even says in the movie, great whites don't swim in warm waters.To finish up, this movie has its very, very few good moments. But it is the weakest Jaws movie in the franchise. Overall: 3/10 and bogus

I've read the reviews here and concur that it was a terrible movie. The only thing that almost hypnotically drew me to it was Michael Caine. It was like watching John Wayne in Pantomine. I kept watching just to catch his performance, and then kept wondering why he did it in the first place. He must already have been a very rich man in 1987, and could not possibly have 'done it for the money'. Surely an actor must have to consider a box office hit in favour of a shed load of money. Not so here it would appear. I'm so disappointed Micheal! But, at the end of the day, it's just another case of over stretching a good idea. There ought to be a law concerning the making of sequels. They are invariably never at least as good as the original, given that that the original was that good to begin with. Even the 'Godfather' series suffered.

About halfway through this movie my allegiance was entirely for the shark and still is. That the shark would find within itself the resources necessary to reduce the remainder of the Brody Clan to shark poop deposited on the floor of the ocean. This was on my mind throughout most of this movie.Sarcasm aside, this movie was ridiculous. Cinematic trash.Don't waste your time. Go do something else, even if it's wrong.Do you have a collectors set of old Laverne & Shirley reruns? Watch those instead. Problem solved ! Or you could take up stamp collecting. Have you considered taking up basket weaving?I digress.

reviews.review_title: Promises much, but ultimately delivers very little.
reviews.content: When I found out about this film some years ago I'd never realised there was a fourth Jaws film. This one ignores Jaws 3-D completely and starts several years after where Jaws 2 finished off. The opening scenes are great. There is a good soundtrack accompanied by eerie camera-work, followed by the genuinely shocking death of one of the Brody sons.In fact, the entire effort involved in making this film seems to have been put into the first ten minutes. After that, Ellen Brody (now a widow, incidentally) goes on holiday. But she is followed by a shark which has defied science with its psychic abilities in finding the relatives of the man who killed its kin, and by rocketing halfway across the world in no time at all. In the Bahamas Ellen meets Michael Caine, wasted in a minor role. From then on the film descends into thrill-less slop. Most of the characters are just irritating, the special effects are terrible (at one point the fake shark seems to be hovering above the water. So, if this shark can fly, can it fly as fast as it can swim? Watch out Richard Branson!) The plot is nonsense - the shark roars, Ellen Brody has flashbacks to events she never even witnessed, people who face seemingly inescapable deaths miraculously come back to life, and the exploding shark makes the scene at the end of Jaws 3-D look believable by comparison.

reviews.review_title: From one of the greatest films ever to this
reviews.content: This is probably the worst sequel ever made and possibly one of the worst films ever made, especially when you consider it cost over 20 million. Made 12 years after Jaws (one of the great films made by one of the great directors), Jaws 4 brought the film franchise to a screeching halt and if Jaws 3 didn't start the huge dip in quality would have been a total shock.Shocking (not in a good way) special effects, horrible acting, terrible writing and an unbelievable story of a vengeful shark tracking the remaining members of the Brody clan from New England to the Bahamas to try and wipe them out.The best parts of this film are the flash back to Chief Brody in the first film.Watch this film if and only if you want to spend days trying to answer these questions.How did a shark track people who took a plane? How did Mario Van Peebles survive being eaten by Bruce? Why only 7 Razzie Award nominations? What did Steven Spielberg think of this?Featured on Episode 75 of The Emerald Reprobates Podcast.

I've only seen this film once, about 10 years ago, but I still recall feeling so let down after seeing this. Lorraine Gary was fine as a supporting roll in the first two films, but she does not come close to saving this movie. Basically, yet another shark shows up at Amity, and the widowed Mrs.Brody is convinced this shark is out for revenge against the Brody family when her adult son (possibly the character that Quaid played in Jaws 3, I'm not sure) is devoured by the shark.
So she goes to the Caribbean. The shark follows. Somehow, Michael Caine and Mario Van Peebles get involved and they set out to re-create the last half hour from the original Jaws. Even going so embarrassingly far as to provide "flashback" footage that none of those characters ever saw first hand! Also known as Jaws 4, run away from this one no matter what it calls itself. Only rates at a two because it is ever so slightly  more tolerable than "C.H.U.D. 2". Stay away!
